etymologies: early 20th century: from dia-‘through’ + Greek thermon ‘heat’

definitions: a medical and surgical technique involving the production of heat in a part of the body by high-frequency electric currents, to stimulate the circulation, relieve pain, destroy unhealthy tissue, or cause bleeding vessels to clot.
shortDefinitions: medical and surgical technique involving production of heat in part of body by high-frequency electric currents
